content.raw: I have the same problem, except without the libprotoc error, only libavformat and libavcodec.
content.html: I have the same problem, except without the libprotoc error, only libavformat and libavcodec.

content.raw: Ouch sorry, I did not see this before. Working on the fix.
content.html: Ouch sorry, I did not see this before. Working on the fix.

content.raw:
I've created the version 2.2.2-3 which should be still consider still experimental. It should fix all the problems with dependencies.

Keep in mind that it could be potentially affected by:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/libtar/+bug/1315742

We are working on how to workaround the problem until Ubuntu fixes the libtar bug in Trusty.
content.html:
I've created the version 2.2.2-3 which should be still consider still experimental. It should fix all the problems with dependencies.

Keep in mind that it could be potentially affected by: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/libtar/+bug/1315742

We are working on how to workaround the problem until Ubuntu fixes the libtar bug in Trusty.

content.raw:
Thank you so much for your update. However in my case when I try launching gzserver it seg faults with the following message:

Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
strlen () at ../sysdeps/x86_64/strlen.S:106
106	../sysdeps/x86_64/strlen.S: No such file or directory.
content.html:
Thank you so much for your update. However in my case when I try launching gzserver it seg faults with the following message:

Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault. strlen () at ../sysdeps/x86_64/strlen.S:106 106 ../sysdeps/x86_64/strlen.S: No such file or directory.

content.raw: As a workaround I've set the env variable GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH to "" and manually copy my desired models into ~/.gazebo/models
content.html: As a workaround I've set the env variable GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH to "" and manually copy my desired models into ~/.gazebo/models

content.raw: Thanks for the feedback @jorhabib_eljaik . The segfault on libtar was expected, I'm working on have it fixed. I'll let you know as soon as the fix is in place. Thanks for the workaround.
content.html: Thanks for the feedback @jorhabib_eljaik . The segfault on libtar was expected, I'm working on have it fixed. I'll let you know as soon as the fix is in place. Thanks for the workaround.

content.raw: Thank you @_jrivero_ , I got rid of my workaround and reinstalled gazebo and things are working fine now :) Thank you very much for your promptness!
content.html: Thank you @jrivero , I got rid of my workaround and reinstalled gazebo and things are working fine now :) Thank you very much for your promptness!

content.raw: Let's consider this fixed, although we need Ubuntu to patch libtar properly.
